ratings.comment: I had her for PH251 last semester, and she was one of the best professors I've had at BU!!! The exam questions were given ahead of time. All you had to do was to be prepared for the exams and participate in the lecture & discussion sections.

She is super sweet and extremely approachable. Exams are super easy as the questions are given out ahead of time, and you can go to her office hours to check your responses before the exam. Highly recommend talking to her and she will help you succeed. You do need to go to class as attendance is taken, but I really liked her lectures anyway.

Stephanie is so kind! She made a course that was really intimidating extremely approachable. The workload isn't heavy at all, with three exams and three case studies plus discussion section attendance making up the grade. Exam questions are given out ahead of time, and if you need extra help, she will always make an effort to meet with you!

Very easy-going class. You're graded on 3 exams, participation, and case studies that are very easy to write because we discuss them in class. The exam is writing-based and you get a question bank of 5 questions that might be asked and you're only tested on 2 of them. You'll never be surprised during an exam because everything is given beforehand.

Sweetest person ever! Besides the strict attendance policy, the class is super chill. She gives you a week to prepare 5 answers to questions, and 2 of those questions are on your exam (lots of hand writing). Other than that, you have to do a one page case study review on 5 out of 7 of the case studies. Participation matters in discussion sections.

Teaches this class at Boston University and is the best professor I've ever had. She is super interesting and personable making the class actually interesting. The course is easy overall if you attend lectures and exam questions are given ahead of time. As long as you attend class you will be fine and it will be an easy class.

Steph is THE BEST TEACHER I've had in UWM. She has clear grading criteria and is a light-hearted teacher. Although it's a 4-credit Comm B class, and thanks to the reviews here, I can attest that Steph is like what others say here. I didn't do the readings on time (googled summaries online) but it is fascinating tbh. Would  to learn from her again.
Stephanie does a great job presenting the concepts. She doesn't use any slideshows, but rather writes everything on the chalkboard. The class is almost entirely based on the three essay exams.

Stephanie was a very good professor, especially for the multitude of business students taking this class. She wrote out the agenda for everyday very clearly on the board and continues to write out every note that you need to take on the board. The class consists of only 3 written exams, which she gives the questions beforehand, and 3 pop quizzes.

Stephanie explains philosophical concepts way better than any instructor I've ever had. The other review is wrong IMO (it is pretty clear which views she personally holds), but that doesn't really impact her teaching. If you want to learn philosophy, take this class with this instructor.

Stephanie was a great teacher for this course. Since she lectures on pretty controversial topics, you would think she was input her own opinion in the material, but she stays neutral! Great comm B class that ISNT boring. 2 short papers and one long 8-10pg paper. This class really makes you challenge your own opinions, I really enjoyed it.
